revised_title: The Impact of Meridional Wind on Satellite Orbits
tldr: This article explores the effect of a meridional wind on a satellite orbit, deriving theoretical formulae to demonstrate how meridional air movement can impact orbits with an eccentricity less than 2. The study focuses on the changes in orbital inclination and the right ascension of the node, considering the drag force acting on the satellite and the velocity of the air relative to the satellite.
